newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH SOFTWARE602 SAYS PLANS CZK 60 MLN IPO.
newsitem.headline: CZECH SOFTWARE602 SAYS PLANS CZK 60 MLN IPO.

text.p: The Czech software company, Software602 a.s., said on Thursday it would soon issue a nominal 60 million crowns in new shares in an initial public offering.
"Software602 a.s. will increase its base capital by offering ... new shares in the form of an IPO with the aim of raising CZK 60 million from local investors," the company said in a statement.

"The fresh cpaital wil be used to finance SoftWare602's expansion into foreign markets. This will primarily involve a sales drive for versions of the company's internet software 602proInternet," it said.
The issue would dillute the company's current stock by 40 percent.
Czech investment house BBG private is the main underwriter of the issue while AKRO Capital a.s. is co-underwriter, it said.
No further details were released, but the company has set a news conference for new Monday, to discuss the offering.
Financial background on the company was not immediately available.
